Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Vintage \Vint"age\ (?; 48), n. [Corrupted by influence of vintner, vintry, from OE. vindage, vendage, for vendange, OF. vendenge, F. vendange, from L. vindemia; vinum wine, grapes + demere to take off; de + emere, originally, to take. See {Wine}, {Redeem}, and cf. {Vindemial}.] 1. The produce of the vine for one season, in grapes or in wine; as, the vintage is abundant; the vintage of 1840. [1913 Webster]
2. The act or time of gathering the crop of grapes, or making the wine for a season. [1913 Webster]
{Vintage spring}, a wine fount.
{Vintage time}, the time of gathering grapes and making wine. --Milton. [1913 Webster]
vintage n 1: a season's yield of wine from a vineyard 2: the oldness of wines [syn: {time of origin}]
